alert.note: Alert for Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 3:11PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Tunica and southwestern Tate Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 311 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tunica, or 13 miles northeast of St Francis National Park, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tunica, North Tunica, Strayhorn, Dubbs, Robinsonville, Little Texas, Clack, Dooley, Savage, Maud, Fox Island, Austin, Clayton, Hollywood, Lost Lake, Prichard, Sarah, Evansville and Bowdre. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
